loans.name: Kelia María

texts.es:
La Señora Kelia María es su tercer préstamo con nuestra institución, ella labora para Colegio público como Profesora de Primaria de cuarto grado. 

El préstamo se le fue otorgado para pagos de mensualidad de la Universidad y mejora de su hogar con la ampliación de dormitorio con la compra de ladrillos (cerámica), cemento y otros materiales, la cual se siente agradecida por la ayuda que siempre se le brinda.
texts.en: Kelia María is in her third loan cycle with the institution. She is a fourth grade teacher in a public school. This loan will be used to make her monthly college payments. Kelia María will also use the loan to improve her house by enlarging a bedroom and buying ceramic bricks, cement, and other materials. She is grateful for the support she always receives.

loans.use: to buy college expenses.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza del Socorro es viuda, con ocho hijos,  posee un negocio de venta de electrodomésticos en el departamento de León desde hace 16 años, inicia sus labores a las 10 am y finalizándolo a las 4 pm visitando a sus clientes, siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia, inicio con un capital de trabajo de C$ 5,000 producto de prestamos.

La señora Esperanza del Socorro está solicitando este crédito para compra de sombrías y abanicos, para aprovechar la temporada de semana santa y así lograr tener mayores ingresos el cual ayudara a obtener un mayor ingreso.
 
Este trabajo lo realiza para aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Esperanza del Socorro is a widow with eight children. She has had a business selling home appliances in the department of León for sixteen years. She starts work at 10am and finishes at 4pm, visiting her clients. This business sustains her family. She started her business with 5,000 Nicaraguan córdobas in working capital, which resulted from loans.

Esperanza del Socorro is applying for this loan to buy umbrellas and fans in order to take advantage of the Holy Week season. This will allow her to obtain better earnings.

She does this work in order to increase her income, thus improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy umbrellas and fans.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever, de 32 años es un hombre responsable y trabajador ,vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace medio año. Su principal actividad económica se centra en la agricultura con la siembra de papa, maíz, alverja y demás hortalizas como lechuga. Ya tiene 8 años dedicándose a este trabajo, afirma ser un hombre responsable y trabajador ya que todos los días trabaja hasta el último rayo del sol, sale a supervisar el crecimiento de sus sembríos como también a limpiar la maleza que crece dentro de ellos y fertilizarlos constantemente. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos incursionando en la crianza de animales, pues ya tiene compradores fijos. Éste es su sexto préstamo con KIVA y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Ever, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Ever is a 32 year old, responsible, hardworking man.  He lives with his wife and two children, and takes care of them in the house he bought six months ago.  His main economic activity centers on agriculture and he plants potatoes, corn, peas, and other vegetables such as lettuce.  He has been engaged in this work for eight years and states that he is a responsible, hardworking man.  Every day, he works until the last ray of the sun sets.  He goes out to monitor the growth of his crops and he also cleans the weeds that grow among them and fertilizes them regularly.  Now, he wishes to improve his income by going into the field of breeding animals as he already has regular buyers.  This is his sixth loan with Kiva and he promises to be punctual with his payments.  Ever will invest the S/.1000 in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish his crops.  .

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Isidra De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Isidra de Jesús  posee un negocio de venta de  frutas y verduras,  en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace catorce años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia que está compuesta por su esposo y tres hijas. 

La señora Isidra  se traslada a su puesto de trabajo desde las 5:00 am para abrir a las 6:00 am y cierra su negocio a las 5:30 pm. Labora de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario y domingo hasta las 4:00 pm.  Ella compra sus productos a  proveedores que la visitan en su puesto de trabajo.  

El  crédito que solicita a Ceprodel lo utilisara para compra de tomate, cebolla, chiltoma  para así ofrecerle a su clientela una variedad de productos de mejor calidad y refrescos para satisfacer su demanda por lo que tendría mayores ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida de ella y su familia.

 Ya que ella sueña con  realizar  mejora en su tramo y ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Isidra de Jesús has been selling fruits and vegetables at one of the markets in León for 14 years. She works to support her family, which comprises her husband and three daughters. Isidra leaves her house at 5:00 to open her stand at 6:00 am, and she closes at 5:30 pm. This is her schedule Monday to Saturday; she closes on Sunday at 4:00 pm. She buys her produce from suppliers who visit the stand.  

She will use the loan from Ceprodel to buy bananas, tomatoes, onions, and chiles so that she can meet customer demand for a variety of quality produce and beverages. This will mean more income to improve her family's life. She dreams of improving and growing her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, tomatoes, onions, and chiles.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha is married and has been blessed with two kids — one is a schoolboy, and the other one is under-aged for schooling. Sokha is a rice grower from Moung Russey district, in Battambang province. She has managed a five-hectare area for growing only paddy rice, while her husband works for others for a fee for extra income, during his spare time. Having engaged for 10 years in the current business, she earns about 28,000 KHR per day.

Sokha and her fellow group member are on their third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her previous loan, and it has sustained her living in a good manner. As a group leader, she will use her portion of this new loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay the fee for plowing the land. She highly hopes that she can gain triple yield, compared to her previous harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay the fee for plowing the land

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Xiomara del Socorro es su primer crédito con nuestra institución, es profesora de educación primaria de un colegio púbico con cinco años de experiencia y el crédito es solicitado para hacerle mejoras en su casa de habitación donde habita con la ampliación de un cuarto donde habita  con sus hijos y su esposo
texts.en: Xiomara del Socorro is in her first loan cycle with the institution. She has been an elementary school teacher in a public school for five years. She has applied for a loan to add a room to the house where she lives with her husband and children.

loans.use: to remodel her house.

loans.name: Fátima De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
El Señora Fátima de los Ángeles es su primer crédito, trabaja para un público desde hace 18 años como maestra de primaria.

Se siente agradecida por la ayuda que le brindo Ceprodel con este préstamo para mejorar su vivienda el cual le va otorgar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia con la ampliación de un dormitorio con el cambio de techo.
texts.en: Fátima de los Ángeles is in her first loan cycle. She has been an elementary teacher in a public school for 18 years. She thanks Ceprodel for its support through this loan that will let her make improvements to her house, expanding a room and replacing the roof, that will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom, 48, is living in a village located in Banteay Meanchey province. She is married and has seven children. Currently, her main sources of income are her handicraft business (handmade fans and baskets) and rice cultivation. She has 24 years of experience in the current business, in which she is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day.

Sokhom has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages, having joined at least six loan cycles ago. She has repaid her previous loan with success and it has better supported her business, as well as her lifestyle, in a gradual manner. Moreover, she is able build a new house for her kids.

Now, she forms a group of two, to apply for a new loan. She is seeking the amount of 800,000 KHR and her co-borrower is taking 1,000,000 KHR. As a group leader, Sokhom will use her loan portion to buy bamboo for producing her handmade products, and potash for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income and uplift her living in a good shape.

loans.use: To buy bamboo for producing handmade fans and baskets, and potash for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Aguida

texts.en:
This is Aguida. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Aguida would like to apply for another loan, this time for 20,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Aguida dreams to have a bigger store and hopes to give her family a good future. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is a business person who sells food products and utensils in the market to her clients to earn a living.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. She is requesting a loan of 35,000 KES to enable her to buy rice, sugar, plates, spoons and other food items.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, plates, spoons and other food items

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora María Eugenia es madre de ocho hijos,  posee un pequeño negocio de venta de comida ubicado  en unos de los mercados del departamento de León desde hace 25 años siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

La señora María Eugenia se presentó a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para realizar compras de productos al por mayor el cual ocupa para la elaboración de los distintos tipos de platillos y brindarle una gran variedad a su clientela.

Este trabajo lo realiza para aumentar sus ingresos de esa manera a mejorado la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: María Eugenia has eight children. She has had a small food stand in a market in the department of León for 25 years. The business supports her family. María Eugenia came to Ceprodel's office to apply for a loan to buy wholesale supplies to make the wide variety of dishes she offers her customers. She will work to increase her earnings so that she and her family can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy wood, oil, rice, chicken, and sodas.

loans.name: Tserenpil

texts.en:
Mr. Tserenpil, 34 years old, lives with his wife and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Tserenpil has been rendering transportation services to local people since 2006 and has accumulated vast amount of experience. His wife stays at home and does household work. 

Using his previous loan, Tserenpil installed a heating system in the house, which helped his family to stay warm during the harsh winter time. This time, he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase some building materials, such as metal, planks and nails to change his fence's gate, and also to purchase furniture, such as a sofa and chairs. As a result, the fences surrounding his house will look well, and new furniture will decorate his house greatly. 

Tserenpil is one of our most trustworthy clients and a very hardworking individual.

loans.use: to change his outdoor gate and purchase furniture.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 36 years old and married with two children. She lives in Jimenez, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. 

Vergie joined GDMPC in 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pig. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pig.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline. She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan in order to purchase more stock of frozen foods like hot dogs, tocino (salt-cured pork), ham and other products. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evangeline dreams of having her own stall and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of frozen foods like hot dogs, tocino, ham and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
Sinoun, a young mother with a little daughter, is a resident from Ek Phnom district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband work at a construction site. To better meet the daily cost of living, this couple also is able to make more income through reaping cassava yield for others. The current income generating activities gain her about 13,700 Riels per day. 

This is the first loan for Sinoun. She leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. For her, she will spend her loan portion to buy necessary materials to support her job. She hopes to earn more income so that she can sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials to support her job at a construction site

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 64 years old and a widow. Remedios works very hard to provide for the family.

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Remedios would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Sophan's Group

texts.en:
A local cassava grower from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Sophan is married and blessed with four children; two of her children are still in school. She has been with the current business for 22 years and is able to earn about 12,300 KHR per day. Her husband also supplements the family income via repairing motorbikes during his spare time. 

Sophan is a new client of VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. This cycle, she is going to use her loan to buy necessary materials to support her husband’s extra business, a motorbike-repairing stall in the local village, for additional income. She hopes this new business will earn her a good income and sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials to support the motorbike-repairing business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old and married with three children. She has a farming business in Kangundo town, where she plants cash crops, such as maize and beans as well as vegetables, for sale. Her business has been profitable.

This will be Rose’s second loan term, and she plans to use the amount to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds, for planting during this rainy season. She anticipates generating more income, which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

Rose hopes to grow her farming business by planting in large scale and selling more varieties of cash crops, and thereby making more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
A rural farmer from Kampong Cham province, Oun is married and has seven children. Currently, only four children still count on her. To sustain her family, she grows cassava on a one and half hectare area and works for others for extra income. Her 26 year engagement in the current business has returned her about 13,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Oun’s group consisting of three females. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy home decorative materials for the upcoming wedding of her child. She hopes this purchase will help her to make the proper decorations for her child.

loans.use: to buy household decorative materials for her child

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

Estrella successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business.

NWTF is listing Estrella's business profile for this new loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
La Señora María Eugenia, posee un negocio de venta de agua, gaseosas, y cosméticos  ubicado en uno de los mercado de la  ciudad de León, desde hace dieciséis  años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia, es madre de dos hijos que están a su cargo,  Sale de su casa de habitación a las 5:30 am  abre su negocio a las 6:00 am posteriormente se desplaza a vender en los buses que viajan a diferentes departamento y finaliza sus labores a las 6:00 pm este trabajo  lo realiza  de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario.

El crédito que está solicitando a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para compra de gaseosas y cosméticos y así aprovechar la temporada de verano. 

Esto le permitirá obtener más ganancia para un mejor nivel de vida de ella y su dos lindo hijos.
texts.en:
For 16 years, María Eugenia has had a business selling water, sodas, and cosmetics at a market in Leon. She works to support her family and has two dependent children. She leaves home Monday through Saturday at 5:30 am to open her business at 6:00 am. Later she leaves to sell her merchandise on buses that travel to other departments in the area. She finishes working at 6:00 pm.

She will use this loan from CEPRODEL to buy water, sodas, and cosmetics to take advantage of the summer season. The loan will allow her to increase profits so that she and her beautiful children can enjoy a better life.

loans.use: to buy water, sodas, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Martha Elena es su primer crédito con ceprodel trabaja como maestra de primaria en una escuela pública desde hace 29 años. 

Este crédito lo utilizara para mejorar el sistema domiciliar de conducción de agua potable con compra de tubos de PVC, inodoros y lavamanos se siente agradecida por la ayuda que se le está brindando por medio de estos préstamos.
texts.en: Martha Elena is in her first loan cycle with Ceprodel. She has been an elementary teacher in a public school for 29 years. She will use this loan to improve the drinking water system in her house by buying PVC pipes, toilets, and wash stands. She is grateful for the support offered to her through the loan program.

loans.use: to buy pipes for drinking water.

loans.name: Kalije

texts.en:
Kalije is a villager who has been involved in the agricultural/livestock business activity for the past fifteen years. She never applied for a loan before because she simply could not; but now she has been given the opportunity from the integrated project in her region and she is on cloud nine. 

Kalije wants to buy dairy cows and fodder with the loan of 250,000 Albanian Lek that she has been approved for and hopes that Kiva lenders will lend to her. “I am responsible and I will pay the money back,” she said smiling.  Kalije is in her late fifties, married, has two children and they live in the area where we are operating our Integrated Projects in the Central Albania.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows and fodder

loans.name: Mouin

texts.en: Mouin is a 46 year old Lebanese man. He’s married to Nabila, a very kind woman. They have four children attending school. Mouin is a great man who loves his family and really cares to offer them a respectable life. He works nonstop, on his own, to be able to cover their expenses. He had been working as a carpenter for more than 10 years until he decided to open his own carpentry business in 2011. He’s an honest man and above all punctual, which make his customers loyal to him. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase an electrical generator. This Kiva loan will facilitate his business operations and improve it as well. He’s doing his best to collect higher revenues and teach his children at high level schools to help them live a very comfortable life away from hard work.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a hardworking woman who is trying her best to make life possible. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mariam is asking for a loan of KES 40,000 to enable her to boost the status of her business. She wants to buy milk, flour, sugar, rice, and salt for sale, and she will use other cash to purchase paints to renovate her kiosk and go on with her business.

loans.use: to buy milk, flour, sugar, rice, and salt for sale.

loans.name: Hasib

texts.en: Hasib is a 25-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married, and lives with his wife and one child. Together with his wife, Hasib is trying his best to make additional income for the family and pay for their child’s costs of living.  Hasib has been working as a blacksmith for the past few years when he decided to work on his own to improve and develop himself in 2009. As he wants to expand his business and increase his work, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase added metal supplies for his business. This will facilitate his work and allow him take bigger projects. Hasib’s greatest dream is to properly educate his child and see him achieve higher positions.

loans.use: to purchase additional metal supplies for his business

loans.name: Sinin's Group

texts.en:
A married mother in her late 20's and residing in Kampong Cham province, Sinin is blessed with two children - one boy and one daughter. Her main source of income for her family is from rice growing on a two hectare area. To supplement her income, she also owns a small vegetable garden.  This 11 year engagement has returned her about 34,700 KHR per day. 

Sinin, a second time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), created a group of two female members to apply for a new loan. She has managed her past loan with success and it has relieved her family’s burden as well as improved  their living conditions.  For this cycle, she will use her loan portion to buy rice seeds, potash, and to pay for plowing fees. She highly hopes that she can stabilize her living status and make more income so she can lease additional farmland for growing more cash-crop and set aside some money to raise pigs for extra income.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, potash, and to pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 55 years old and married with four children. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Paul owns and operates a transportation transport service to earn a living. He has been in his business for over five years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

He has been in GDMPC since the year 2010. Now, he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires.  

Paul plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 29-year-old man. He’s single and lives in Lebanon with his parents and six siblings. Two of them are working in addition to their father who is considered the main income provider for the family.  Despite his age, Hasan is obliged to work continually as he thinks of having his own family in the future. He has been working in the construction field since 2008. He’s specialized in floor covering and has gained a fair number of clients asking for his services. Regardless of being satisfied with what he has attained so far, he suffers from a bad financial situation; which is the reason why he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva's Partner Vitas s.a.l.  He will use the loan to improve his business by purchasing new construction tools which will help him continue to offer the best quality work. In the near future, Hasan plans to take added loans to open his own paves shop. He works really hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing new construction tools

loans.name: Zebur

texts.en:
Zebur is 27 years old. He lives in the village of Kakhaber, in the Khelvachauri district with his parents, 27-years-old brother and retired grandmother. Zebur requested loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

All the family members work at the local hotel. Zebur works as an administrator, his brother as a barmen, mother as a cleaner and father as a manager. The hotel is very small so the salaries are very small too. Their additional income is Zebur’s grandmothers’ monthly pension. The family's total income is hardly enough to cover monthly expenses.

Zebur requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Zebur will purchase a car. The hotel where they all work doesn’t have a car to serve the clients, so he wants to buy a car and rent it to the hotel owners. This will bring him an additional monthly income. With the increased income Zebur will be able to help his family with covering their expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 54-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He has been working as a cleaning services provider since 1988. He works independently upon a client’s request. He gives good quality services to his clients, and this is what helps him to attract other customers very easily. Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to purchase cleaning machines and to renew his tools. In this way, he will be able to increase his profits; thus, enhance his family’s way of living. In the future, he plans to open his own cleaning services office and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning machines and renew his tools

loans.name: Ghanem

texts.en: Ghanem is a 62-year-old married man living with his wife and two children; one of them is still attending school, and the youngest is working. After gaining many years of experience, he was able to open his own barbershop. Due to his good business reputation, he was capable of building a good number of loyal customers. With his requested loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., he will purchase shaving tools and supplies in addition of paying his child’s education costs. In this way, he will satisfy his customer’s demands and serve them well. He is positive about his business, wishing to develop it the best he can and maybe hire people to work with him.

loans.use: To purchase shaving tools and supplies

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is married and the mother of two grown children. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 15 years. This is their source of income. 

Juanita is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of their fishing boat. This investment will enable her husband to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Juanita hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of a fishing boat

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a Lebanese married man. He’s 44 years old. He’s really attached to his wife and four children. Cooperating together, Youssef and his wife were able to cover their heavy life expenses in order to live a respectable life. He started his own business at an early age. He had to work with high professionalism to prove that he’s a necessary support for his family. Youssef started his own work in 1992. He has been working as a car mechanic in his own garage and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to buy added tools for his business in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He believes that acting properly is really essential to attract more customers. In the future, he plans to expand his business and gain more profits.

loans.use: To buy needed tools for his business

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 32 years old. He lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with his 56-year-old uncle and 31-year-old cousin, Levan. Mikheil requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Mikheil has a car. He drives it as a taxi to earn a daily income. His uncle is working on the bus line. Mikheil’s cousin, Levan, is an artisan and works on constructions and renovations for private orders. They all get a small monthly income.

Mikheil requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Mikheil will install gas equipment in his car, as it is much cheaper than petrol. He will continue driving it as a taxi. This will significantly decrease his expenses and increase his profit. Having an increased income will give Mikheil an opportunity to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To install gas equipment in his car

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer de 32 años de edad luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria completa que junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos se han podido superar gracias a la dedicación en la actividad del cultivo de hortalizas (papa). Ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad ya que aprendió la actividad hace más de 12 años dicha experiencia la  adquirió cuando se casó siendo su pareja quien le enseñara la siembra y cultivo de hortalizas sus hijos son menores de edad 2 de ellos (mayores) estudian en la escuela y diariamente apoyan a sus padres al salir de la escuela.

Teresa junto a su esposo trabajan duro para que sus hijos no dejen de estudiar y tengan un mejor futuro, un mejor estilo de vida y no pasen por la situación tan difícil que ellos en su juventud pasaron. Su producto es comercializado a través de intermediarios que llegan a la zona teniendo una gran reputación por su calidad, higiene y forma de trabajar; pero como toda siembra y cultivo no deja de tener riesgo siendo estos las plagas y la variación de precios en el mercado. Actualmente Teresa solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la siembra de papa comprando fertilizantes, abono, y bombas para fumigación a su producto para que ayude a mantenerlo sano y limpio de plagas.

Sus metas son de poder ampliar sus tierra para poder cultivar mucho mas y generar mas ganancias para su familia y re-invertir en su negocio hasta tener un capital propio. Su sueño es poder cultivar una variedad de verduras para ofrecer mas a sus clientes y consumidores de la zona obteniendo mas ingresos y de esa forma apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y todos sus sueños y metas a cumplir.
texts.en:
Teresa is a determined 32-year-old woman with a primary school-level education. Together with her husband and their four children, she has been able to overcome her limited education thanks to their work growing vegetables (potatoes). She has a great deal of experience in this business, as she learned it more than twelve years ago when she got married; her husband is the one who taught her how to plant and grow vegetables. Her children are all minors; the two older ones are students and help their parents when they get out of school every day.

Teresa and her husband work hard so that their children won't have to quit school and will instead have a better future, a better way of life, and won't face the very difficult situation that they experienced in their youth. Their produce is sold through brokers who come to their area because of their good reputation for quality, hygiene, and work ethic. But, as with every crop, there are always risks, like disease and market price variations. 

Currently, Teresa is requesting help so she can to invest in her potato crop by buying fertilizers, soil amendments, and pumps for fumigating her crop to help keep it healthy and free of disease. Her goals are to be able to expand her land so she can grow a lot more and generate more earnings for her family and to reinvest in her business until she has her own capital. Her dream is to be able to cultivate a variety of vegetables so she can offer more to her customers and consumers in the region, thereby earning more income and supporting her children in their educations and in all their dreams and goals.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, soil amendments, and fumigation pumps for her potato crops.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina has been engaged in a sewing business for more than 30 years now. She accepts orders and clothing repairs from the people in her place in Loon, Bohol. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Marcelina is asking for a loan to buy materials for sewing like cloth, thread, needles and other materials. With this, she will be able to sew and accept more orders, thus increasing her earnings. 

In the future, Marcelina hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing like cloth, thread, needles and other materials.

loans.name: Grupo 308 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GRUPO 308”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silvia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa, tejido de mantas, costura y venta de polleras, trenzado de mantas, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silvia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa; mismo que decide emprender hace varios años comenzando con un pequeño capital, que en la actualidad ha ido mejorando.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa) que adquirirá de las ferias provinciales de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de una de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Grupo 308” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Community Center. This group consists of seven members and is led a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Silvia as its president. The members of the Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling potatoes, weaving blankets, sewing and selling traditional skirts, making braided blankets, and managing a neighborhood store.

This loan will benefit small businesswomen such as Sra. Silvia. She said that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is also a member of the organization. Silvia currently manages a business that involves selling potatoes. She started this business several years ago with a small amount of capital. It is improving at the moment.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying potatoes. She acquires her inventory at the provincial fairs in the city of La Paz and then sells her products at one of the other fairs in the city of La Paz. Working in this manner enables her to generate income so that she can sustain her household. Silvia is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Silvia said that she enjoys the loans.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
La señora María de 48 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos que depende de ella, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de fresco, pollo, embutidos, agua en bolsa, churros, duces, verduras y pan su negocio está ubicado en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña María  sus ventas  son de lunes a domingo y sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de la comunidad y pescadores.
Doña María  está solicitando el  préstamo para compra de abarrotería como aceite, café, azúcar, leche en polvo, papel higiénico,  frescos, agua, pan, arroz, frijoles, etc. Y Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando su negocio.
Doña María  su sueño es mejorar más su negocio y  que sea uno de los más fuertes de la comunidad.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 48 years old, single, and has two dependent children. For the past 10 years, she has been in the business of selling soft drinks, chicken, cured meats, bottled water, donuts, candy, vegetables, and bread. Her business is located in a community of San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras.

Doña María conducts her sales Monday through Sunday. Her customers include friends, neighbors in the community, and fishermen. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy groceries such as oil, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, toilet paper, soft drinks, water, bread, rice, beans, and other items. With her profits and the support of this loan, she will be able to move forward and continue improving her business.

Doña María dreams of improving her business even more so that it is among the strongest in the community.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March 2013

loans.use: to buy oil, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, toilet paper, soft drinks, water, bread, rice, beans, and other items.

loans.name: Jose Blas

texts.es: Don Jose, de 58 años de edad, esta casado y tiene dos hijos, el vive con su esposa e hijos en una colonia que pertenece al sector de la Lopez Arellano, municipio de Choloma. El lleva aproximadamente 40 años de dedicarse a la ebanistería donde elabora muebles de cocina, puertas, contramarcos de puertas, sillas, mesas, etc. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo a ODEF por 8,000 Lempiras para comprar materiales como ser madera, barniz, pinturas, lijas, pegamento etc.para la fabricación de muebles y cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes. El tiene como meta ayudar a sus hijos a que logren un buen estudio y también desea tener otro vehículo mejor para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Jose, who is 58 years old, is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in a neighborhood located in the La Lopez Arellano area of the municipality of Choloma. 

Jose has been working as a woodworker for approximately forty years, making cabinets, doors, door frames, chairs, tables, etc. He decided to request a second loan from ODEF for 8,000 lempiras (HNL) in order to buy materials like wood, varnish, paint, sandpaper, glue, etc., for making furniture to fill customer orders. His goal is to help his children to get a good education, and he would also like to have a better vehicle for his work.

loans.use: to purchase wood, varnish, paint, sandpaper, glue, etc., for making furniture.

loans.name: 3.1.268.04.thiệu Phú Group

texts.en:
Hương is the group leader of the 3.1.268.04.Thiệu Phú solidarity group, which consists of five members. Her children are grown, so Hương supports no dependents with her business. 

This is Hương’s first loan with Thanh Hoá Fund of Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future. A lack of capital is one of the most critical business difficulties that concern her.

With her business profits, Hương hopes to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat, 66 years old, is married to a local farmer and blessed with two children. Neither of her daughters is under her support. They are currently working to pay for their own and financially support the family as well. They are residing in the Bak Thmenh village of Kompong Speu province. 

Phat, together with her husband, has been cultivating rice on their own farmland in the village for almost 40 years. Despite her hardships, Phat aims to make a consistent income and earn a comfortable lifestyle to provide for her family.

She wants a loan amounting to USD 1,000 to build a strong ladder up to her house and also extend her house to make it bigger. This will make their lives more comfortable. 

Phat is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her living standard.

loans.use: to build a strong ladder up to her house and extend the house.

loans.name: Ma. Emma

texts.en:
Ma. Emma is 46 years old and married with eight children. Three of her children are in school. 

Ma. Emma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Emma has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angel Polivio

texts.es:
El Señor Ángel vive en Quevedo (Ecuador), el tiene 52 años de edad. El empezó a trabajar con un triciclo desde los años 1988 transportando a las personas o cargas, luego tuvo la oportunidad de asociarse en una cooperativa, y compro una moto taxi, esto le ayudo mucho porque era mas cómodo y menos cansado y producía mas dinero.

El trabaja como transportista, desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta la noche. Los momentos en que a él se le dificulta trabajar cuando llueve y cuando enferma.  El no tiene esposa, tiene 3 hijas, están en escuela fiscal.

El usara el préstamo para comprar llantas, herramientas. El desea para el futuro poder incrementar su negocio con mas tricimotos.
texts.en:
Ángel, age 52, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  He started working with a tricycle in 1988.  He transported passengers and cargo.  Then he had the opportunity to associate with a cooperative, and he bought a ‘moto taxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle].  This helped him a lot because it was more comfortable, less tiring, and produced more money.

He works as a driver from 6:00 a.m. until the nighttime.  The times that it is difficult for him to work are when it rains and when he is ill.  He does not have a wife.  He has three daughters, and they attend public school.

He will use the loan to buy tires and tools.  In the future he wishes to be able to increase his business with more three wheeled motorized vehicles.

loans.use: to buy tires and tools.

loans.name: Sita Benita

texts.es:
La Señora Sita Benita es docente de unos de los colegios de la ciudad de león desde hace más de 16 años, inicia sus labores a las 7:00 am y finaliza a la 12:00 pm de lunes a viernes con este mismo horario, siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

La Señora Sita Benita está solicitando este crédito para compra de perlines, láminas de zinc, con los cuales procederá a la reparación del techo de su casa de habitación antes de que inicie la temporada de invierno, el cual este crédito le beneficiara en la mejora de su vivienda y su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Sita Benita has been a teacher in one of Leon's schools for more than 16 years. She starts her job at 7 am and finishes at 12 pm. She has this same schedule Monday through Friday. This job provides support for her family. Sita Benita is asking for this loan to buy purlins and corrugated roofing, which she will use to repair the roof of her home before winter starts. This loan will help her improve her home and her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy purlins and corrugated roofing

loans.name: Emilio Bernabé

texts.es:
Emilio habita en el municipio del Sauce, un bello y encantador Pueblo, donde existen diferentes actividades comerciante.  

Emilio Bernabé se llama el Joven de 36 años edad Luchadora por su vida y la de su familia, cuenta con tres hijos bajo su cargo, se dedica a brindar sus servicios en su propio negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación el cual es mecánico de moto, donde repara las motos a diferentes clientes del municipio.

Hoy en día se vio la necesidad de querer mejorar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que solicita a kiva y Ceprodel que le financien un crédito para la compra de Cemento, Arena, zin y pago de mano de Obra, esto sería de gran importancia porque le permitiría vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia. 

Agradece a Kiva y Ceprodel que ayudan con crédito y que siempre piensan en las personas con deseo de vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Emilio lives in El Sauce, a beautiful, charming town with a variety of business enterprises.  Emilio is a young, 36 year old man who works hard for his life and that of his family.  He has three children under his care.  He is a motorcycle mechanic and owns his own business, located at his home.  He provides repair services to various customers in town.  Today, he sees the need to repair his home’s roof.  For this reason, he is requesting financing from Kiva and Ceprodel to purchase cement, sand, zinc metal sheets, and to pay for labor costs.  This loan is very important because it would allow him to live in better conditions with his family.  He is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for helping him with the loan and for always thinking about people’s desires to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, zinc metal sheets, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Adriana Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Adriana se dedica desde hace 8 años a la costura de ropa donde elabora trajes para damas, niños y más.

Este crédito lo u paratilizara para mejoras de su vivienda en ampliación de dormitorio con la compra de ladrillos y cemento, le agradece a Ceprodel por la ayuda que siempre le brinda con los prestamos que le han otorgado.
texts.en: For eight years, Adriana has been engaged in sewing clothes, making suits for women, children, and others.  She will use this loan to purchase bricks and cement to improve her home by enlarging her bedroom.  She is grateful to Ceprodel for helping her and always offering the loans that they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for home improvement.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy, de 41 años, es un hombre feliz y responsable. Hace 12 años que convive con Jessica, su esposa, a la que quiere mucho y con la que tiene 2 hijos; a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace algunos años.  
Desde muy joven comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura y sus principales cultivos constan de papa, alverja y maíz, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder limpiar la maleza de entre sus sembríos; pero lo que le disgusta son las temporadas de helada que existen producto de las lluvias, ya que pierde muchos sembríos, generándole pérdidas. Por esa razón y porque Fredy es una persona muy inteligente, se dedica también a la ganadería; criando carneros, cerdos, y cuyes, los cuales engorda y revende a un buen precio, logrando así solventar las necesidades de su familia. Le va muy bien en su negocio, por ello está pensando adquirir una estancia, donde pueda cuidar mejor a sus animales.  Fredy, invertirá los 3,500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en: Fredy, 41, is a happy and responsible man. He has lived with his wife Jessica for 12 years. He loves her very much and they have two children together. They care for them in the house that they bought some years ago. He has worked in agriculture since he was very young and his main crops are potatoes, peas, and corn. He plants them on his own farmland. What he likes most about his work is being able to clear the weeds from his crops. What he doesn't like are the frosts that come on due to the rain, because he loses many crops, generating losses. For this reason, and because he is a very smart person, Fredy also has livestock. He raises rams, pigs, and guinea pigs, which he fattens and then sells at a good price. This way, he meets his family's needs. Things are going well for him in his business, so he is thinking about buying a ranch, where he can care for his animals better. Fredy will invest the 3,500 soles in organic fertilizer to nourish his fields and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Cecilia Mirna

texts.es:
La Señora Cecilia Mirna es su tercer crédito, es maestra del colegio de primaria en una escuela público desde hace 33 años.

Este crédito sera  utilizado para reparación de cambio de techo en la compra de zinc, alfajillas, clavos y otros materiales para mejorar en un dormitorio el techo
texts.en: This is the third loan for Cecilia Mirna. She has been a primary school teacher in a public school for 33 years. This loan will be used to make repairs to the roof, and for the purchase of corrugated roofing, boards, nails, and other materials to improve the roof in one room.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia del Carmen, inicia sus actividades a las 6 de la mañana en punto ofertando lo que es ropa de todo tipo, así como también frutas, finaliza sus labores a las 5 de la tarde. Su puesto está ubicado en un  mercado de León donde realiza esta actividad para la mantención de su hija que tanto ama.

El crédito será utilizado para la compra de productos de mayor calidad tales como: tobilleras, blúmeres, bóxer, camisetas, delantales, blusas y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes logrando incrementar sus ventas que le ayudaran a mejorar su calidad de vida.

Se siente agradecida porque anteriormente ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel y le han ayudado a incrementar su capital de trabajo y así comprar sus productos por mayor donde le  ha permitido mayores ganancias y así ha logrado a  mejorar sus condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Ofelia del Carmen opens her business at exactly six o'clock in the morning, selling all kinds of clothing as well as fruit. She wraps up her workday at five o'clock in the evening. Her stand is located in a market in León where she does carries out her work to provide for her daughter, whom she loves so much.

The loan will be used to purchase top-quality products like ankle socks, underwear, boxer shorts, tee shirts, aprons, and blouses so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers, thereby increasing her sales; this will help her to improve her quality of life.

She feels grateful because she has taken out loans from Ceprodel previously and they helped her to increase her working capital so that she could buy her products at wholesale, allowing her to earn greater profits. With greater profits, she was able to improve living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase socks, underwear, boxer shorts, tee shirts, aprons, blouses, linens, bedspreads, children's outfits, smocks, etc.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilú es una mujer de 36 años de edad joven, con muchas fuerza, emprendedora y muchas ganas de superarse, casada que de su matrimonio tiene 2 hijos los cuales viven bajo su techo, estudian en la escuela y dependen de ella en todos los aspectos. Ella es una mujer que día con día en compañía de su esposo ven la manera de cómo generar ingresos para su hogar y que gracias a su empeño pudo apertura un negocio el cual está orientado a la venta de lácteos como mantequilla, queso, quesillo, etc. en la zona donde ella habita. La tierra en la que ellos cultivan los productos básicos como maíz y frijol la obtuvo por medio de una herencia de sus padres. Sus clientes para los diferentes productos que ella vende y produce son vecinos y comunidades aledañas a la zona donde ella habita. Sus cultivos están a una distancia de 100 metros de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente ella aprendió dicha actividad desde muy joven ya que sus padres son agricultores desde toda una vida.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para sus cultivos de maíz y frijol el cual lo mantendrá sano y limpio de plangas que dañen los mismos.

Sus metas a corto plazo es poder comprar unas vacas y máquinas para poder producir su propio producto el cual le generara mayores ingresos y disminuirá los costos de compra para revender al igual que sacar una cosecha limpia y sana para aprovecharla al 100%. Su sueño es enviar a sus hijos a la universidad para que ellos puedan estudiar y superarse que aprendan carreras que les ayuden a mejorar el negocio que ella está levantando y pase a ser una empresa.
texts.en: Marilú, 36, is an enterprising young woman with a lot of strength and a lot of desire to excel. She is married and has two children who live at home. They study in school and depend on her for everything. Day after day, together with her husband, she has looked for a way to earn an income for their household. Thanks to her effort, she was able to open a business that sells dairy products like butter, and different types of cheese in the area where they live. She got the land where they grow things like corn and beans as an inheritance from her parents. Her customers for the different products that she sells and makes are neighbors and nearby communities close to where she lives. Her crops are 100 meters from her house. She walks there every day. She learned this activity when she was very young, because her parents have been farmers their whole lives. Currently, she is asking for help to buy fertilizers and manure for her corn and bean crops. This will keep them safe and free from the plagues that damage them. Her short-term goal is to buy some cows and machines to produce her own products. This will help her earn a higher income and lower the cost of buying to resell, as well as getting a clean and safe harvest to take advantage of it 100%. Her dream is to send her children to university so that they can study and excel and have careers that help them to improve the business she is setting up so that it becomes a company.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her corn and bean crops

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Teresa de 58 años de edad se dedica a todo tipo de artesania como dulces, bisuteria entre otros, vive en una casa que alquilan desde hace 28 años con su esposo que trabaja de mecanico, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos que se le prentan en su hogar, tambien obtienen la ayuda de una nieta que les manda remesas cada mes, ella solicita el credito para poder comprar mas materiales y productos para elaborar sus ventas y obtener mas ganacias para poder llevar una vida mejor al lado de su esposo.
texts.en: Teresa is 58 years old and she is engaged in all types of artisanal crafts such as sweets, costume jewelry, and other products.  She lives with her husband, a mechanic, in a home they have rented for twenty-eight years.  With the profits she obtains and her husband’s help, they manage to cover the household expenses.  They also receive help from their granddaughter who sends them money each month.  She is requesting this loan to purchase more materials and products to make sales and earn more profits so that she can have a better life at her husband’s side.

loans.use: to purchase artisanal materials.

loans.name: Teresa Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Teresa del Socorro es su primer crédito en ceprodel, ella se dedica desde hace 12 años como maestra de primaria en una escuela pública.

Este crédito sera  utilizado para reparación de máquina de coser para brindarle un poco mas de ingreso en su hogar ya que en su tiempo libre elabora trajes para dama (faldas, camisas, blusas) y caballeros se siente agradecida por la ayuda que le puedan brindar por medio de estos préstamos.
texts.en:
Teresa del Socorro is asking for her first loan from Ceprodel. For 12 years she has worked as a primary school teacher at a public school. 

She will use this loan to repair her sewing machine to obtain a little more income for her home since during her spare time she sews women's clothes (skirts, shirts, blouses) and men's clothes. She is grateful for your help by way of these loans.

loans.use: to repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолату 60 лет. Она за мужем, но не имеет детей. Адолат более 30 лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт в данном бизнесе. Она имеет 3 коровы и 1,45 га земли, где выращивает сено для скота. Она живет в отдаленном районе и население живет не густо и поэтому Адолат тоже имеет большой дом. Она очень довольна своим бизнесом. Она всегда мечтала иметь детей. Она мечтает увеличить доход от бизнеса и помочь сиротам, тем детям, которые не имеют родителей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Этот займ поможет ей выполнить социальную миссию. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Adolat is 60 years old. She is married but has no children. For over 30 years, Adolat has been raising livestock and has plenty of experience with this work. She owns three cows and 1.45 ha [about 3.5 acres] of land, where she grows hay for her cattle. She lives in a remote area  with low population density, which is why Adolat is able to own a large house. She is very satisfied with her business. She has always dreamt of having children. Her dream now is to increase her business income and be able to help orphans, children without parents. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy cattle. This loan will help her to fulfill her social mission. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for developing her business.

loans.name: Jacson Orlando

texts.es:
El Señor Jacson vive en Orquídeas, el tiene 34 años de edad.
El empezó hace 5 años  adquirió un vehículo,   con un crédito que adquirió pudo completar para comprar otro carro y ahora tiene 2 vehículos  de alquiler.
El sale a realizar su trabajo de 6:30 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche, y el otro lo alquila.
El no tiene esposa, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad están en escuela fiscal.
El usara el préstamo para arreglar su auto con llantas, frenos etc.
El desea en el futuro tener su propia casa para darles mejor comodidad a sus hijos, y poder conservar su auto ya que es su única fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Jacson, age 34, lives in Orquídes.  He started five years ago and got a vehicle.  With a loan that he got he was able to finish buying another car.  Now he has two vehicles to rent.

He leaves to work at 6:30 a.m., and he works until 10:00 p.m.  He rents the other one.

He does not have a wife.  He has two minor children, and they attend public school.

He will use the loan to fix up his car with tires and brakes, etc.

In the future he wishes to have his own house in order to make his children more comfortable.  He wishes to be able to keep up his car because it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to provide maintenance to his car by purchasing tires and brakes, etc.

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en:
Em, 49, is a mother of three kids; two are still in school. She is also a local citizen from Kampong Cham province. She works on two, 2-hectare areas of land, one for rice and the other for cassava cultivation. This is the main source of her family's income, whereas working for others for a fee is the supplementary income.

Em’s Group is comprised of two female members, who are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, Em will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, and to pay the fee for weeding her land. She hopes this purchase will help her to boost her crop output and gain a high yield, so that she can sell the crops for a high price and make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, and to pay the fee for weeding the land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Magda Elizabeth

texts.es: Magda, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, vive en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes, junto a sus tres hijos, yerno y una nieta. Magda lleva 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de golosinas como ser: tajadas de plátano, chicharrones y palomitas de maíz en bolsas en ristras. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y le esta yendo bien. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo que es por 7,000 Lempiras y los utilizara en la compra de materia prima como plátanos, sal, condimentos, chicharrones, bolsas etc. para hacer las ristras de tajadas, chicharrones y vender. Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande y obtener más ingresos.
texts.en: Magda is 42 years old.  She is a single mother, and lives with her three children, son-in-law, and granddaughter in a community belonging to the town of Choloma, Cortés.   For five years, Magda has been engaged in selling sweets such as plantain slices, pork rinds, and popcorn in bags with string.  She has this business in her home and it is going well.  She is requesting her second loan of 7,000 lempiras and will use the funds to purchase supplies such as plantains, salt, seasonings, pork rinds, bags, etc.  to make the stringed slices and pork rinds to sell. Her dream is to expand her business and earn higher income.

loans.use: to purchase supples (oil, plantains, seasonings, bags, salt, pork rinds, etc.)

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen vive en Guayaquil (Orquídeas), ella tiene 34 años de edad. A ella le gustan las ventas desde hace 10 años, ella se dedica a este tipo de negocio porque le genera ingresos, y así puede obtener dinero para sustentar los gastos del hogar. 

Ella realiza la venta de cosméticos, de ropa,  desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde, todos los días. Ella no está casada, no tiene hijos. 

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar mercadería como cosmeticos, zapatos, carteras, perfumes. Ella desea para el futuro poder comprarse un vehículo, y seguir trabajando porque ese es el sustento de ella y de sus padres.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 34, lives in Guayaquil (Orquídeas).  She has liked sales for ten years.  She devotes herself to this type of business because it generates income for her.  This way she is able to get money to cover the household expenses.

She sells cosmetics and clothes from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. every day.  

She is not married, and she does not have children.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise like cosmetics, shoes, purses, and perfume.

In the future she wishes to be able to buy a vehicle and to continue working.  This is because this is how she supports herself and her parents.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like cosmetics, shoes, purses, and perfume.

loans.name: Las Tiunfadoras De Santa María Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria esta unida de hecho, tiene 30 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo y de escolaridad tercero primaria; ella se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, inició este negocio con un capital de Q.300.00 y hasta la fecha lleva ya 4 años de experiencia en el negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es maestro de educacion primaria.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un credito que lo utilizará para la compra de gallinas y chompipes para engordarlos y luego venderlos, en el futuro muy cercaco quiere tener una granja de dichas aves. Las demás integrantes se dedican tambiéna a criar aves de corral y a vender ropa típica.
texts.en:
Maria is in a de facto relationship. She is 30 years old and has one primary-school age son. She earns her living raising fowl. This business has a capital value of  Q.300.00 and she has 4 years of experience with the business. She relies on her husband's support, her husband being a primary school teacher.  

She is organizing a group and asking for a loan which she will use to buy chickens and turkeys to fatten and sell. In the near future she hopes to have a farm with these birds. The other members also work raising domestic fowl and selling traditional clothing.

loans.use: to buy chickens and turkeys.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is aged 44 and has been blessed with four children. She is a rice grower on one hectare of land, with the support of her husband. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn up to 37,000 KHR per day.

Chanthy and the other two borrowers of this group are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). These borrowers are seeking to borrow 1,000,000 KHR, each. As the group leader, Chanthy will use her loan portion to buy rice seed and potash for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income, so that she can enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and potash for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo, 45 years old, is married and has four school-going children. He owns a house with neither electricity nor water supplied. For the past few years he has been doing business, selling cereals to his customers as a retailer, to earn a living and support his family and pay school fees for his children. 

Kyalo is requesting a loan of KES 10,000. He will use the loan to buy dried beans, maize, cashew nuts, and rice, to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy dried beans, maize, cashew nuts, and rice, to boost his business

loans.name: Jose Fausto

texts.es: Don Fausto de 59 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia desde hace varios años, vive con su esposa y sus hijas en casa propia, con las de ventas de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar pero necesita hacerle una mejora a su vivienda ya que con lo que gana no le es suficiente para realizarlo por eso solicita un credito para hacerle algunos cambios para que su familia y el puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: Fausto is 59 years old.  He has been engaged in farming and cattle raising for several years.  He and his wife and children live in their own home.  With the sales of his crops, he manages to pay some household expenses.  However, he needs to make a home improvement and the income he earns is not enough to pay for it.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to make some changes so that he and his family can live more safely.  .

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Sheyla Vanessa

texts.es: Sheyla es una señorita de 24 años de edad que  estudió la carrera de Ciencias Sociales y Humanidades en una Universidad pública. Estudio esta carrera, pues le gusta enseñar e interactuar con alumnos. Con el  préstamo anterior obtuvo el título profesional en esta especialidad. Es por ello que inscribió en la escuela de posgrado en maestría que dura dos años aproximadamente. El crédito lo requiere para el pago del ciclo en este curso. Realizarse como docente y ser una especialista en pedagogía es su meta, pues luego va a  continuar estudiando pues así asegura ella tendrá mejor oportunidad laboral. Sheyla agradece a los prestamistas Kiva, ya que le permite cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Sheyla is a 24 year old woman who studies social science and humanities at the public university. She studied this major because she likes to teach and interact with students. With the previous loan, she obtained her degree in this specialty. That is why she registered for a post-graduate program for a masters that lasts for approximately two years. She needs the loan to pay for the semester in this course. Becoming a teacher and a specialist in education is her goal. She will continue to study and thus ensure that she has better job opportunities. Sheyla is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since they have allowed her to meet her goals.

loans.use: to pay for a post-graduate course.

loans.name: Yoem's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Yoem is married and strives for a living by farming rice on one hectare of land. She has been involved in the current business for 18 years and is able to earn up to 39,500 KHR per day.

Yoem is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), as are the other two members of Yoem's group. They are seeking to borrow 1,000,000 KHR, each. As the group leader, Yoem will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay the fee for plowing the land. She hopes that she will gain triple yield next harvest, and make more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay the fee for plowing the land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chhean's Group

texts.en:
Chhean, who lives in Dambae district, Kampong Cham province, is a  51-year-old mother of 11 children. Now, only five children still rely on her, as they are in school. She earns a daily living by farming rice and cassava on four hectares of land. After five years' engagement in the current business, she earns about 20,900 KHR per day.

This is the fifth loan for Chhean with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her previous loan with success and made good progress in her living status. Now she is in a group of three, to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, and to pay fees for plowing and labor. She hopes to make more income and to sustain her lifestyle in a good pace.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, and to pay fees for plowing and labor

loans.name: Sokkhy

texts.en:
Sokkhy, age 35, lives in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. He is the father of one schoolchild and two children who are too little for school. To feed his kids, he farms rice on 2.5 hectares of land, and cassava on 1.5 hectares. He has been able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day from the business, for nine years.

His first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) was four loan cycles ago. He has completely repaid his previous loan, which has supported his business and returned to him a decent income with which to support his family and keep his child in school. For this new loan cycle, he is going to use his loan to pay fees for plowing and transplanting, and to buy potash to use on his crop. He hopes to earn more income and to improve his living.

loans.use: to pay fees for plowing and transplanting, and to buy potash to use on his crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
This is Margarita. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase a greater quantity and variety of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell. Her earnings helped her to meet her personal, household, and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial addition with a glad and thankful heart.

Margarita dreams that her future will be secure and hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Angelo

texts.es:
Manuel de 23 años es estudiante de Administración Industrial en una Universidad local

Manuel eligió esta carrera porque es muy competitiva y tiene mucho futuro en el mercado sus estudios le demandan 6 años de los cuales ya cursa el tercer año, se siente feliz porque su mayor logro será cumplir su objetivo principal, convertirse en un profesional exitoso, durante la semana estudia aproximadamente 25 horas; en la actualidad trabaja en una empresa como auxiliar. Manuel ha solicitado el préstamo para pagar un ciclo de pensiones en la universidad y así continuar con sus estudios, está agradecido por el apoyo de sus padres y también quiere agradecer a los Inversionistas de KIVA quienes hacen posible su préstamo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 23 year old industrial management student at the local university.

Manuel chose this major because it is very competitive and very marketable. He has already finished 3 years of the 6 year program. He is happy because he is working toward his main goal, to become a successful professional.  He studies for approximately 25 hours a week and is currently working for a business as an assistant. He is requesting this loan so he can pay for board at the university and continue with his studies. He is grateful to his parent’s for their support and to all the Kiva lenders who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: pay his university board fees.

loans.name: Pritty

texts.en:
Pritty, 46, is married and has four children. She owns a house, with neither electricity nor water supplied. She runs a grocery in her residence, and her customers are her neighbors.

She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000. She will use the loan to buy produce to resell, like potatoes, tomatoes, onions and cereals, to help her get profit and continue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy produce to resell, like potatoes, tomatoes, onions and cereals

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Aged 33 and a resident of Kampong Cham province, Chanthy is married and blessed with two children—one schoolboy and one little boy. She has managed one hectare for growing rice and two hectares for growing cassava. The 13 years of experience in the current business has returned her about 41,000 KHR per day. Chanthy has never been with VisionFund before. She is now seeking 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and to pay the fees for weeding and plowing. She hopes to grow her cash-crop fruitfully and in a timely fashion so that she can obtain more income to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow more crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the fees for weeding and plowing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea, originally from Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, is 36 years old and a widow. She has two children to care for as they are still in school. One hectare of rice cropping and one hectare of cassava planting are the main source of her family's income. To supplement the family’s income, she also works for others for a fee. From the current business, she is able to earn up to 32,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Sophea. She is seeking for 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes to gain a high yield and sell it with a good price so she can build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: Residing in the local area of Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Sokhom is 32 years old and has three children. She and he husband make a living through slaughtering cows as the main source of family income. She has engaged in the current business for 10 years and is able to earn up to 36,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Sokhom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid back her past loan with success, and it has improved her living with a positive outcome. For this cycle, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy cows for slaughtering for resale. She hopes to make more income and stabilize her living.

loans.use: To buy cows for slaughtering

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sokkhy's Group
